itemLabel: Barbara Wootton, Baroness Wootton of Abinger

wikipedia_page.main: Barbara Wootton, Baroness Wootton of Abinger CH (14 April 1897 – 11 July 1988) was a British sociologist and criminologist. She was one of the first four life peers appointed under the Life Peerages Act 1958. She was President of the British Sociological Association from 1959 to 1964.

response: * October 21 – The Life Peerages Act entitles women to sit in the British House of Lords for the first time. The Baronesses Swanborough (Stella Isaacs, Marchioness of Reading) and Wootton (Barbara Wootton, Baroness Wootton of Abinger) are the first to take their seats.
*Barbara Wootton, Baroness Wootton of Abinger (with V. G. Seal and R. Chambers) – Social Science and Social Pathology
* 11 July – Barbara Wootton, Baroness Wootton of Abinger, sociologist and life peer (born 1897)
#REDIRECT Barbara Wootton, Baroness Wootton of Abinger
* 8 August – Barbara Wootton, Baroness Wootton of Abinger becomes the first female peer in her own right.
